node.statement: LEMMA (cost-dominance). For ultrametric norm N on k², vectors u,w∈k², and scalar α∈k: N(u)N(w) + N(αu)N(w) ≥ N(u+αu)N(w) is trivially false in general (wrong direction). The real question: does N(c₁e₁-αv₃)N(w₁) + N(v₃)N(αw₁+βw₂) ≥ N(c₁e₁)N(w₁) = |c₁|N(w₁) hold when the third term absorbs the cost of splitting?
